titles: Some considerations propounded to the Jewes that they may hear and consider, and their hearts at length may be turned towards that which alone is able to convert them to God, that they may once more become His people, and enter into an everlasting covenant with Him that may not be broken, that so they may abide in His love and covenant of life, and remain His people for ever.
author: Penington, Isaac, 1616-1679.
notes: Attributed to Isaac Penington. Cf. NUC pre-1956.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
